Problem:
Consider a complex function \\( z(t) = e^{i \omega t} \\), where \\( \omega \\) is a constant real number, representing angular frequency. We analyze the system under a Fourier transform \\( F(z)(\omega) = \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} e^{-i \omega t} z(t) dt \\).

If an arbitrary constant phase shift \\( e^{i \phi} \\) is applied to \\( z(t) \\) before applying the Fourier transform, will the resulting frequency-domain representation \\( F(z)(\omega) \\) be affected solely by the original \\( \omega \\), without influence from \\( \phi \\)?
Explanation: The phase shift \\( e^{i \phi} \\) modifies the function by adding a constant phase to all components of \\( z(t) \\). This intervention shifts the spectrum in the frequency domain, affecting the phases of each frequency component, although not altering the magnitude spectrum.
